title: Quickstart not working
body:
The documentation in the quickstart does not specify how to install the package carla, so the examples in pythonapi/examples exit with an error. However spectator mode still works.

Windows 10, Carla 0.9.10
author: arihant2math

comments.body:
Hi arihant2math, 

Using Carla Package u just need to unzip the file you have downloaded. 

Then you need to start CARLA (CarlaUE4.exe) first. And then you can run any of the examples inside the PythonAPI / examples folder.
I did that, the examples still do not work.
Hi @arihant2math, what error are you getting?
I'm getting this error when I run `spawn_npc.py`: `ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'carla'`

Can you make sure that the PYTHONPATH is set correctly by running the following, or adding it to your `.bashrc` file:

```
export PYTHONPATH=$PYTHONPATH:"$HOME/<path/to/carla>/PythonAPI/carla/dist/<name_of_egg_file>.egg"
export PYTHONPATH=$PYTHONPATH:"$HOME/<path/to/carla>/carla"
export PYTHONPATH=$PYTHONPATH:"$HOME/<path/to/carla>/carla/PythonAPI/"
```
@corkyw10 I am using windows.

Hi @arihant2math, sorry for the misunderstanding. Can you look in the directory `carla\PythonAPI\carla\dist\` and check the `.egg` file there? It should look like this `carla-<version>-py3.7-win-amd64.egg`. The part `py3.7` will indicate the version of Python that should be used, it's normally 3.7 in the package versions. Can you confirm that you are running the scripts with Python 3.7?
I was using python 3.9, using 3.7 fixed the problem.

title: Following a vehicle
body:
I am a beginner trying to learn Carla. Thank you for the detailed documentation, but I am unable to find how to achieve the following. 

I wish to create a simulation in which vehicle_1 follows the path being followed by vehicle_2 while keeping the throttle and brake control independent of the movement of vehicle_2. 

I tried specifying it while spawning vehicle_1 as follows, but that does not work.
`vehicle_1 = try_spawn_actor(blueprint, spawn_point, attach_to=self.vehicle_2, attachment_type=carla.AttachmentType.Rigid)`

Can someone please give a pointer on how this can be done?
author: ayushshah

comments.body:
@ayushshah 
Hi,

Are you sure this can be done? 
Because this type of attachment seems more suitable for a sensor, than a vehicle... 
If this was a real-life scenario, the simplest solution, which comes to mind, would be for the following vehicle to apply controls, in such a way that the a certain distance between it and the leading vehicle would be maintained. 
You would build a controller, which would be driven by the distance to the lead vehicle. 
As a start, you could try to use the VehiclePIDController (from PythonAPI/agents/navigation/controller.py), continuously updating it's target waypoint to a lead vehicle's past location. 
A better approach would be retrieve the distance to the lead vehicle, using the lead vehicle's and the following vehicle's locations and feed it to a controller.

Good luck,
Gabi Shahmayster

Thank you for the detailed answer. I am able to follow the lead vehicle using controller.py. 

Cheers!

title: How can i get radar resolution in Carla?
body:
Is the radar resolution available in Carla? I can't find it anywhere.
Please tell me how can i get it, thanks very much!
author: kannidekan

comments.body: @kannidekan that concept does not apply to our "radar" because the data generated by the radar is not given in a "per-object" way. In other words, the radar is not attempting to differentiate between multiple targets. Instead, it is providing information about multiple locations that could correspond to the same target (object).
@germanros1987 Ok, i got it. Thanks very much!

title: Custom background vehicle model in Carla
body:
Hello,

Thanks for making a great simulator. I am doing a project in which I need to **customize all vehicles' dynamic models** in the Carla environment (for example, the vehicle will get the ground truth information and decide to change the lane or change the acceleration).

In order to get information about all the vehicles, I use the following codes:
```
waypoint_list = [world.get_map().get_waypoint(v.get_location(), project_to_road=True) for v in vehicles_list]
```

As I have about 200 vehicles in the Town04 map, I noticed that the line above cost me about 5 seconds each time, which can not meet the real-time requirements. My Carla version is 0.9.9 and runs on Ubuntu 18.04 with i9-9900k and 64 Gb RAM.

I wonder if there are other solutions to let me **customize the control model** of the vehicles using the **provided PythonAPI**, or I may need to modify the source code of Carla to reach my purpose?

Thanks!
author: miracelplus

comments.body: @miracelplus you just want to get the location of all the vehicles for a given time instant? @glopezdiest could you provide a more effective way to  do this?

Hey @miracelplus. Could you provide a little more detail to your process? What are you gonna use the waypoint_list for? Isn't the location of the vehicles good enough? From what you've showed, the only recommendation i can tell you is, don't get the map every time, store it in a variable once and call it to get the waypoints.

Hello,

Thanks for your reply! I’m working on customizing my own vehicle model (car following and lane change). The detailed usage of my application is like this:

1.For every second, I need to get the information for each vehicle
2.Then, I decide the next-second acceleration for this vehicle. 
3.I use waypoint for each vehicle and get the acceleration from my own decision part in order to keep the vehicle on the lane. 
4.Calculate the next waypoint the vehicle should achieve given specific acceleration.
5.Teleport the vehicle to the new waypoint

That’s how I finish my customized car-following model. I know this may be a dumb usage of provided PythonAPI. Therefore, I wonder if there’s some more efficient ways that I can fulfill my goal?

Thanks!

I see. I'm still a bit confused though.

From what I understand, you only care about the acceleration of the vehicle, which you are using to move (teleport) the vehicle. Are you using this specific approach instead of using a controller for some reason?

Why are you using the waypoints instead of the location, because they are in the middle of the road so you only care about going forward?

You seem to only care about using waypoints but you are getting them from the vehicle location on each frame (the command you showed at the beginning of this issue). So how are you calculating this "next waypoint"? You can just use the *carla.Waypoint.next()* function, which should remove the use of that location-to-waypoint-loop, speeding up the process.

Those any of this makes sense? I may have just completely missunderstood what you are trying to achieve

Hello,

I’m using this approach instead of a controller is because that some of my customizing model need all the vehicles’ information around one specific vehicle. Therefore, I choose to use the PythonAPI to get all the vehicle’s information and individually control each of them. I wonder if the controller method can get the information of surrounding vehicles (like 5 or 6 vehicles around this vehicle).

Also, the usage of waypoint method is that I wish the vehicle can follow the road, for example, the vehicle is on a curve shaped road and I wish to control the “longitudinal” acceleration of it. Is there some more straightforward method to achieve this goal? I’m only using Carla for a short period of time so I may miss some more useful approaches.

The waypoint.next method is very helpful to my usage. Deleting the location-to-waypoint method accelerates the running speed.

Thanks for your reply, that means a lot to me.

> Is there some more straightforward method to achieve this goal?

No, I think you are doing the correct approach here, but I've never though about it so I was confused. 

> The waypoint.next method is very helpful to my usage.

Good to hear :+1:. I'm leaving this issue open in case your solution isn't final, but please, remember to close it if you find that it's resolved
Thanks a lot!

title: side road intersection in carla 0.9.5
body:
Thanks for Carla team for the great updates in Carla 0.9.x 
in Carla 0.8.x there were some useful features like the offroad_intersection measurement which I can't find in Carla 0.9.5.
Does anyone have any idea how to get this measurement in Carla 0.9.5?
author: pirate-lofy

comments.body: Does anybody has any idea how to solve this, please?

Please, do not get too attached to old versions. Why not moving to 0.9.9? 

@glopezdiest could you point @pirate-lofy how to detect the off-road situation?

Hey @pirate-lofy. According to the docs: 

> These values are computed intersecting the bounding box of the vehicle (as a 2D rectangle) against the map image of the city

I don't think that measurement is available anymore so you'd have to calculate it yourself. You'd need some serious geometry to get the line that intersects the bounding box, and some calculus to get the percentage off-road. There might a library that does this very efficiently but I can't think of one. 

An approximation would be to get the eight points of the bounding box (vertices and middle points) and get how many of the 8 are offroad. To know if you are off_road you can either:
1) get_waypoint(self, location, project_to_road=False), which will return None if the location is outside driving lane
2) get_waypoint(self, location, project_to_road=False, lane_type=carla.LaneType.Any), which will return a waypoint, and if its lane_type is different than *Driving*, the location is out.
@glopezdiest  that was so helpful thanks a lot it worked

title: does running Carla's docker image require the installation of Unreal engine?
body: I'm pretty much new to Docker, do I need to install the Unreal engine 4 before running the Carla container on my machine?
author: ahmedessameldin1elfakharany

comments.body: No, the docker image contains only a Carla binary. Just as if you download the binary version, you don't need Unreal to run it.
Thank you for your answer.

title: no effect with FPS and benchmark flag
body:
Hi,
I started the carla server in this way:
    ./CarlaUE4.sh -benchmark -fps=10 -windowed

And then run manual_control.py. I'm sure manual_control.py is connecting to the carla server started just now in that I can see the same vehicle in the same position in pygame and server scene. But in the hud, the server FPS is always around 30 despite the value of fps flag, which is almost the same as when I started the carla server without benchmark and fps flags. I'm very confused about it. Appreciate any suggestion. Thanks.
author: tanglrHello

comments.body:
Hi @tanglrHello,

The FPS shown in the "manual_control.py" is measured in real-time, with a timer, just to test the performance of the server. What you may want to see is the simulation-time, e.g.
```diff
--- a/PythonAPI/manual_control.py
+++ b/PythonAPI/manual_control.py
@@ -307,7 +307,7 @@ class HUD(object):
 
     def on_world_tick(self, timestamp):
         self._server_clock.tick()
-        self.server_fps = self._server_clock.get_fps()
+        self.server_fps = 1.0 / timestamp.delta_seconds
         self.frame_number = timestamp.frame_count
         self.simulation_time = timestamp.elapsed_seconds
```
It works! Thank you so much.

In my understanding, if I set the fps of the simulator to 10, OnTick() will be executed 10 times per second. If I spawn a sensor in the carla world and add a callback function for the sensor, the callback function will also be executed 10 times per second at the same pace with OnTick(). But when I add a print time command in _parse_image() of manual_control.py, it shows the print lines are around 30 times in a single second, which means the callback function are executed 30 times per second. And as I modified the code in the way you suggested, server fps in hud is around 10.
I'd like to know what is wrong with my comprehension. Expecting your reply. Thank you!

`OnTick()` callbacks are called 10 times per _simulation-second_, but it's actually called as fast as your hardware is able to compute. Meaning, every object in the simulation sees steps of 0.1ms, but you will observe the simulation like moving fast-forward. On the opposite, if you set an FPS of say 500, the vehicles are updated 500 times per _simulation-second_, but you'll observe the simulation in slow motion.

In other words, if you run with `-benchmark -fps=60`, save the images, and play them at 60 fps the video will look real-time.
It's clear to me now. Thanks for the reply!

title: vehicle speed direction.
body: Does anybody knows how to get the speed direction of the vehicles? From what I know, the yaw direction of the vehicle is not exactly the speed direction.
author: einsteinguang333

comments.body: Hi @Romanenko-Serhii , yes you are right. It seem's that we can't get this information directly from carla, so maybe using this differential method is the best way. Thank you!

title: Available vehicle library and Default vehicle
body:
Hello everyone,

I am using CARLA 0.8.4 and I am trying to run it by changing default vehicle to two wheeled vehicle, but I am not able to.

I have seen that I can change the model in initial settings at, 'PlayerVehicle', like this
"PlayerVehicle=/Game/Blueprints/Vehicles/BmwGrandTourer/BmwGranTourer.BmwGranTourer_C"

But my problem is, I am not able to find these blueprints (Since I have not built CARLA from source, but just using pre-compiled versions). Can someone help me in finding models for bike?

Note: As it is easy enough to change the default vehicle by knowing the models and path, I think it would be good idea to have a text file with all the vehicle models available. It will make it easier for the documentation.

PS: Please excuse me if this question is really basic or if there is already such file existing. I have not been in touch with CARLA from past few months.
author: n-akram

comments.body:
Hi @n-akram, sorry for the late response, we were on vacations.

You are totally right about it.

## Cars
Format:
```ini
PlayerVehicle=/Game/Blueprints/Vehicles/Model/Model.Model_C
```
Example
```ini
PlayerVehicle=/Game/Blueprints/Vehicles/AudiA2/AudiA2.AudiA2_C
```
And these are the models:
```
AudiA2
AudiTT
BmwGrandTourer
BmwIsetta
CarlaCola
ChevroletImpala
CitroenC3
DodgeChargePolice
JeepWranglerRubicon
Mercedes
Mini
Mustang
NissanMicra
NissanPatrol
SeatLeon
Tesla
ToyotaPrius
VolkswagenT2
```
Except for the `BmwGrandTourer` that someone missed the `d` on the file name

## Bikes
Format:
```ini
/Game/Blueprints/Vehicles/2Wheeled/Model/Model.Model_C
```
Example
```ini
/Game/Blueprints/Vehicles/2Wheeled/CrossBike/CrossBikeBP.CrossBikeBP_C
```

And these are the models:
```
CrossBike/CrossBikeBP.CrossBikeBP_C
Harley/HarleyBP.HarleyBP_C
KawasakiNinja/KawasakiNinjaBP.KawasakiNinjaBP_C
LeisureBike/LeisureBikeBP.LeisureBikeBP_C
RoadBike/roadBikeBP.roadBikeBP_C
Vespa/VespaBP.VespaBP_C
Yamaha/YamahaBp.YamahaBp_C
```

I wrote all of them because in this case there is a general misspelling of upper case and lower case (I don't know if it really matters in Unreal), also a `BP` at the end of the file.

I'm sure our artists will fix it soon!

Hope it help!
Let me reopen this issue until the spelling errors got fixed :)
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.

title: Import own fbx file to generate road?
body:
Hi all, I am new to Carla and want to create a environment based on my city.
I imported my .fbx file into CarlaUE4 project as new roads, but then carla client didn't work.
It seems that the CarlaMapGenerator is a must to run carla client? If so, how can I 
create my own roads rather than randomly generated roads?
Thanks!
author: yjumpzhighy

comments.body:
Hi @yangzuyuanhao,

It is possible to use your own roads without the CarlaMapGenerator, but you'll get the annoying message `Controller doesn't have a road map!` (and of course the autopilot won't work). As a hack to get rid of this message you can add a CarlaMapGenerator somewhere far where is not visible, it will create the road map so the controllers are happy.

Now if you want the autopilot to work (depending on how complex is your road layout), you can create way-points with our RoutePlanner.

HI @nsubiron ,
Thanks for your help! I tried your suggestions by moving the  carla generated map far away.
However, the controller works only when the playerstart is outside of my own-created-road. There seems to be a clear boundary. Once I move the playerstart into my own city range, the controller fails
immediately.
The autopilot needs our roads to work, otherwise it thinks it's off-road.

@nsubiron 
Sorry for confusion, it is not autopilot. 
Error happens after I start the server (clicked the play button in UE4), with error message:
PIE: Error: Blueprint Runtime Error: Accessed None trying to read property CallFunc_GetPlayerPawn_ReturnValue from function: 'ExecuteUbergraph_Weather' from node: AttachToComponent in graph: EventGraph in object: Weather with description: Accessed None trying to read property CallFunc_GetPlayerPawn_ReturnValue
Do you have _"Carla Game Mode"_ selected as game mode in the project settings? Can you check if inside it it has the default pawn set?

Hi @nsubiron, yes, the project settings are good.
By the way, the error won't happen if I drop my playerstart outside my own-created-road. It makes me
fell confused.
Uhm I'm confused too. Can it be that there is some collider near your player start so the vehicle fails to spawn because collision?
Hi @nsubiron , pretty sure no objects near my playerstart. Actually, anywhere inside my own-created-road-range would reproduce that error...

Hi @yangzuyuanhao 

Please, open your road's model and check "simple collision" under "collision drawing options" to see the mesh collider.
A common problem when trying to import big road models into Unreal is that the automatic collision generated when importing goes far up trying to cover the entire model with very few polygons. If this is true for your model you could either delete your simple collision and generate one manually yourself (Most efficient) or, in the details panel of the mesh, under collision, change collision complexity to "Use Complex Collision as Simple" this way it will use all the geometry of the model as collision (This option is a bit more costly but will probably work right away).

Hello everyone,
I am interested in importing my own 3D model into CARLA for simulated images. Can you please provide me with a detailed guide or tutorial on how to do this? I would greatly appreciate any information you can provide.

Thank you.

I would like to know if the Point Cloud data obtained comes already with some simulated noise or instead it is perfect data.  I think is the second one, then I should add the noise by myself if I need it. I just want to confirm.

Thanks for your help and the great work you are doing with the simulator.

comments.body:
Hi @luigui2906!

You can add a _ditsortion_ by car movement running the simulator using high `fps`.

Cheers!

title: How can I change manual_control.py into third-person view?
body:
Hi.

When I run `manual_control.py`, it starts as first person view game.
However, I want change it into third-person view like carla-server mode.
I mean, I want to debug my environment, so It's fine as long as I have the way to control vehicle manually, while outputting data.
I think `VehicleControl()` is effective but I'm not sure about it.
Is there any way?
author: kanchi0914

comments.body:
Hey @kanchi0914.
What you can do is just modify the RGB camera and set a custom position and rotation behind your car.
Something like:
```py
camera0.set_position(-5.0, 0.0, 2.0)
camera0.set_rotation(-20.0, 0.0, 0.0)
```
But if you want to receive the main (_first person_) camera anyway, you can add another camera, set it behind your car like before, and display the new one while gathering data from your original camera.

Thank you for your reply. it sounds that will work for me.
So, do you mean We can't apply keyboard input while server-mode without Pygame?

It is pygame who catch the keyboard events, but you can use another python method to get the input.
What you can't do (right now) is control from the Unreal while using a client.
OK, I understand. Thank you for your kindness!

title: Where is /Game/Maps/Town02 located, Windows version?
body: I just beginning to use the simulator, and did some work with the default `Town01`, my question is where is `Town02` located I can't find it anywhere, I must be missing something.
author: m090009

comments.body: usually it's in .\Carla_0.8.2\PythonClient\carla\planner
So how can I run the simulator with **Town02**, I did this  `CarlaUE4.exe /Game/Maps/Town02` but neither `maps` nor `Game` folders are in the Windows installation

It refers to the Unreal project content folder, so, it's inside the .pak file of the build version (each platform has different pak files, example: \CarlaUE4\Content\Paks\CarlaUE4-WindowsNoEditor.pak ) but if you open the editor it would be something like CARLA/Unreal/CarlaUE4/Content/Maps/Town02.umap
Ok, So is there a way form me to run the Windows build version with Town02?

Yes, for example with the version 0.8.2 it should be something like this:

> CarlaUE4.exe /Game/Maps/Town02 -windowed -ResX=640 -ResY=480

notice that the map is the first parameter.
We will include an option for [LevelSettings] in CarlaSettings.ini called MapName to change the map also.
Thanks a lot @juaxix , its working now. Yeah levelSetting would be great for pre-programmed sim.

Hello,@juaxix 
Is there any way to add my own map into  the .pak file of the build version? so I could run carla by `./CarlaUE4.sh /Game/Maps/mymap ` and could load my own map.
@JackRen88 have you solved your problem. I now create a map and then I use the "make package" to create a package, but I cannot find my map in the Maps folder.

this works for me
CarlaUE4.exe Town01  --carla-server

> Hello,@juaxix
> Is there any way to add my own map into the .pak file of the build version? so I could run carla by `./CarlaUE4.sh /Game/Maps/mymap ` and could load my own map.

Have you found a solution?

> Hello,@juaxix Is there any way to add my own map into the .pak file of the build version? so I could run carla by `./CarlaUE4.sh /Game/Maps/mymap ` and could load my own map.

Any solution on this?

So I managed to do it and I hope this will help someone in the future.

RoadRunner:

Create your map and export it using Carla Filmbox, you get .xodr and .fbx files inside of a Exports folder inside of your RoadRunner project

Carla (Source build):

1. Take .fbx and .xodr file and place them into the Import folder
2. Using x64 VS 2019 cmd window while being at the root of your Carla folder, run make import ARGS="--package=exp_town"
3. You will get your package created inside of [Carla root]\Unreal\CarlaUE4\Content\exp_town (default is map_package)
4. Once that is done, you will be able to open this map inside of your Unreal Carla Editor where you can do further customization, like adding a spawn point, etc ...
5. Once you're done editing, using the x64 VS 2019 cmd from the root Carla folder, run make package ARGS="--packages=exp_town"
6. When that finishes you will get one zip file and one folder with the same names inside of [Carla root]\Build\UE4Carla
7. Now simply take that zip file and distribute it whereever you want and use the python config.py --map "map_name" command to change the map in your NoEditor Carla Server. What I do is since I have a VM where I keep my source built Carla I take that folder and transfer the contents of it to my binary built Carla on my local computer.

> It refers to the Unreal project content folder, so, it's inside the .pak file of the build version (each platform has different pak files, example: \CarlaUE4\Content\Paks\CarlaUE4-WindowsNoEditor.pak ) but if you open the editor it would be something like CARLA/Unreal/CarlaUE4/Content/Maps/Town02.umap

hello, i'm meeting the problem that after downloading the 0.8.4 version and run `sh ./CarlaUE4.sh /Game/Carla/Maps/Town01 -windowed -world-port=2000  -benchmark -fps=10` it came error that 
`the map specified on the commandline '/Game/Carla/Maps/Town01' couldn't be found. Would you like to load the default map instead? `. 

And I want to edit the .pak file but I can't open it , could u give me some suggestion how to solve it.

title: Error of Compiling Image_Converter
body:

I have an error when compiling the image_converter script following the instructions in the post #165 .
Can someone help me out?
The following is the error I got when running "make" under the directory of /carla/Util/ImageConverter/:

```
clang++ -Wall -Wextra -std=c++14 -fopenmp -O3 -DNDEBUG -o bin/image_converter main.cpp -lboost_system -lboost_filesystem -lboost_program_options -lpng -ljpeg -ltiff
In file included from main.cpp:16:
In file included from ./image_converter.h:10:
./image_io.h:174:5: error: static_assert failed "I/O format not supported!"
    static_assert(IO_READER::is_supported, "I/O format not supported!");
    ^             ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
main.cpp:54:35: note: in instantiation of template class
      'image_converter::image_file<image_converter::tiff_io,
      image_converter::tiff_io, boost::gil::image<boost::gil::pixel<unsigned
      char, boost::gil::layout<boost::mpl::vector3<boost::gil::red_t,
      boost::gil::green_t, boost::gil::blue_t>, boost::mpl::range_c<int, 0, 3> >
      >, false, std::allocator<unsigned char> > >' requested here
  image_converter::image_file<IO> file_io(in_filename);
                                  ^
main.cpp:71:7: note: in instantiation of function template specialization
      'parse_image<image_converter::tiff_io>' requested here
      parse_image<ic::tiff_io>(in_filename, out_filename, converter);
      ^
1 error generated.
Makefile:11: recipe for target 'release' failed
make: *** [release] Error 1
```

BTW, I have followed the README to install all necessary libs. 

Any helps are highly appreciated!
Best regards,
Taylor
author: tayloryang722

comments.body:
True, I have the same error.

Installing `tiff5` dev library worked for me

    sudo apt-get install libtiff5-dev

Hi nsubiron,

Thanks for your prompt response.

The problem was solved.

Best,
Taylor

title: Does the new release of carla has mapping coordinates on Town1 and Town2?
body:
I just upgraded to the new carla release to use the LiDAR sensors.
However, In the old release, I used the 
x          =             measurements.player_measurements.transform.location.x
y          =             measurements.player_measurements.transform.location.y

Then 

x_pixel = (x + 1643) // 16.43 
y_pixel = (y + 1643) // 16.43 
pixel = Town_image[int(y_pixel), int(x_pixel)]

Which will give me the mapping of the exact pixel in the Town1 from the world coordinates.

Suddenly when I switched to the new Carla release this mapping factor does not work.

Please advice.
author: LoayMAmin

comments.body: The measurements are now sent in meters (previously it was in centimeters) #273. That's probably it.
Fixed. Thank you.

title: Navigation
body:
How do the AI cars navigate in Carla?

I have checked some navigation tutorials for UE4, but it seems Carla is using something more complex.
author: curantil

comments.body: We implemented our own controller, the code can be found at "WheeledVehicleAIController.cpp". We use information about the road lanes that is generated when building the map, as well as trigger volumes for traffic lights and signs.

Ok, if I understand it correctly, it works as follows:
- The map and basic navigation is created with the CarlaMapGenerator
- The player car (and if enough spawnpoints available, the non-player cars too) are spawned at a random PlayerStart. Those starts have to be placed manually on the map.
- Without anything else added, the cars will drive around at 20km/h with the preference at intersections of going straight, otherwise turning left.
- The SpeedLimiters can be used to easily change the speed the car is driving at (10km/h below the speedl limit)
- For random routes around the map, an IntersectionEntrance is used on which the different turning options can be created. Every route consists of one or more Actors that are the waypoints on that route over the intersection.
- Cars obey TrafficLights, but those lights need to be scripted to change color.

Is this correct?

Sometimes I get "Error: Controller doesn't have a roadmap!" and one or more cars will not move around. Any idea what could be the cause of this problem?

Yes, that's basically it. The intersections are handled by IntersectionEntrance, otherwise the car just go straight until it finds a road patch with defined direction.

 A couple of comments to bear in mind for future versions
  * Cars drive 10km/h below speed limit due to a bug #5 (we want to fix this but doesn't have much priority as 10km/h below is still reasonable)
  * IntersectionEntrance will be replaced by RoutePlanner, it will be added in the next release. It's a bit more efficient and the routes are displayed with splines that looks clearer.

> Sometimes I get "Error: Controller doesn't have a roadmap!" and one or more cars will not move around. Any idea what could be the cause of this problem?

Can it be that you are dragging and dropping cars directly to the scene? Or using custom vehicles?

> Can it be that you are dragging and dropping cars directly to the scene? Or using custom vehicles?

No. I didn't add any cars to the scene, only PlayerStarts nor have I created custom vehicles.

I also get the message : `Error: Requested 10 vehicles, but we were only able to spawn 1` although it successfully spawns 15 vehicles. (I have 18 PlayerStarts) Could it be something in the spawning process?

Do you have a vehicle spawner already in the map? This actor is spawned by the game mode at begin play, you should not add a second one to the scene. The one you added doesn't have a reference to the road map thus the vehicles spawned by it are also missing this ref.

> Do you have a vehicle spawner already in the map?

Alright! That seems to be the cause. I removed it and now it works. Thanks.
Could you please explain why trigger volumes are used near traffic lights and signs?

with use of that cars understand arrive near a traffic lights and signs
    On Tuesday, July 10, 2018, 2:29:16 AM GMT+4:30, Ishaan Paranjape <notifications@github.com> wrote:  
 
 
Could you please explain why trigger volumes are used near traffic lights and signs?

—
You are receiving this because you commented.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
@ishaan95 yes, as @abdoly says. The speed limit signs and traffic lights notify this way the vehicles, and the intersections use this to detect vehicles and assign them a route.

title: How to get camera intrinsic matrix?
body:
Thank you for publishing this great drive simulator code.
I am trying to map depth points(u,v,depth) from Pixel coordinates to World coordinates(x,y,z).
To do this, Camera intrinsic parameter is necessary. I found that "CameraFOV(horizontal field of view) and ImageSize (in ```CarlaSettings.ini```)" is parameters for calculating camera intrinsic matrix. I thought as following.
```
Focus_length = ImageSizeX /(2 * tan(CameraFOV * π / 360))
Center_X = ImageSizeX / 2
Center_Y = ImageSizeY / 2
```
But I found this intrinsic matrix is not correct enough because 3D points (transformed from depth points(u,v,depth) by this matrix) has some distortion. 

Could you tell me how to get camera intrinsic matrix? 

(Now I think Focus_length_per_pixel (fx, fy) or distortion parameter is necessary for this. )

[P.S.]
To confirm whether my implementation is correct, please tell me the definition of depth length in each image pixel. I think this depth is the length from Camera coordinate original point to each point.
(not simply z value in Camera coordinate)
author: syinari0123

comments.body:
Hello @syinari0123,

Sorry for the late response.

Yes, the depth is perpendicular to the projection plane.

We've been doing some experiments and we've got results without noticiable distortion.
Your code is correct to me, and the intrinsic matrix shoud be the following one:

    K = [[f, 0, Cu],
         [0, f, Cv],
         [0, 0, 1 ]]

Where Cu and Cv represents the center point of the image.

Given a 2D point ```p2d = [u,v,1]```, your world point position ```P = [X,Y,Z]``` will be:

    P = ( inv(K) * p2d ) * depth

We're working on a example integrating the point cloud with the python client.
I hope we are going to release it soon :)

Due to #58 we can't get the correct camera world rotation, but it will be fixed in the next release.

Thank you for replying.
I modified my code following as what you say, I was able to get correct result ! Thank you! :)

I thought depth is the ray length to each point from the pole (like LIDAR sensor's value, what is called, "r in polar coordinate system" ), which caused distortion in my code.
Glad it worked! :)
